intro: Renealmia dewevrei, commonly known as the dwarf reed, is a herbaceous plant native to the wetlands of Central and South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit. The plant typically features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in marshy or swampy environments. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in wetland gardens.
